content.description: The bluffs along Kachemak Bay on your way outside of town are a great ice climbing destination during the darkest time of the year, mid December to mid January.  All of the climbs are mostly south facing and if there is any sun whatsoever they start to melt quickly.  Act fast to enjoy these easy to access climbs and you'll be rewarded with a very unusual experience-climbing ice at sea level, on a beach!
